channel.title: Posts on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on PR

item.title: Instagram Challenge - 2019
item.description: Year after year, I see so many gifted people share their art during month of October tagged #inktober Guess what, I wanted to join last year and I did.

item.title: 2019 Review
item.description: I ain’t no Stephen Wolfram but I do try to time myself on any activities I do on my computer whenever possible.

item.title: Book: 'Never Grow Up' by Jackie Chan
item.description: Jackie Chan is the first action star I remember from my childhood. I know Bruce Lee and his fame but never seen his movies, coming to think of it, I do not remember if I have ever seen any one of his movie complete at all, to date.

item.title: SwiftUML - Generate PlantUML class diagram from Swift source code
item.description: At any point in time, I will always have few project ideas around source code parsing, building a tokenizer or creating a custom DSL and syntaxes.

item.title: Script to delete xcode buildconfigurations
item.description: Yes, you do not need this solution, unless you know for sure you have one too many build configs and it is time consuming to delete one by one.

item.title: Whatchanged - Git history as HTML Report
item.description: Recently I was requested to produce a report of changes in a git repo between two tags by testing team.

item.title: Flickr - How not to design backup userdata when shutting down your service
item.description: Happy New Year - 2019 It is always easy to find fault than fixing. So this isn’t very hard to start this year blogging write a rant.

item.title: My Raspberry Pi Collection
item.description: I’ve always been interested in Raspberry Pi. I pre-ordered, waited for about 3+ months and even paid Customs (ridiculous amount) to import my very first Pi.

item.title: Happy Teachers Day
item.description: This is a post I’m meaning to write for a very long time. I wanted to write this every year around Teachers day (5-Sep) and failed to publish.

item.title: Script to publish Hugo sites for Github
item.description: While deploying my recent hugo website to github, I re-learnt that, you can only publish gh-pages from master branch for user or organization repository.

item.title: Website redesign
item.description: Today I’m launching the redesigned website palaniraja.com. It’s a shame that I took to this much time to update my own website which I’ve paying for years.

item.title: Dropbox Mac - Deletes files on reinstallation?
item.description: I uninstalled Dropbox from my work mac before submitting my laptop of reimaging of OS with corporate junk installations. Since I was sure, I should be able to install it again and download all synced files back on mac, I had deleted before handing over to IT people.

item.title: Pilapse - Raspberry Pi Camera and Timelapse
item.description: It is a simple python script to capture timelapse with few more addition option than raspistill -tl. Built-in command usage: raspistill -t 30000 -tl 2000 -o image%04d.

item.title: Merging multiple MP4 videos with FFMPEG
item.description: I have a collection of video tutorials split into multiple sections and multiple clips in each section. I wanted to merge the files to one, so I can upload and download from services like Google Drive & Dropbox.

item.title: Poor man's pdf diff tool
item.description: Recently a client shared updated requirement document, unfortunately the document was in PDF and I don’t want to go through 60+ pages of document for changes.

item.title: Book Recommendations
item.description: I was too lazy to write blog post for a long time. To break my lazy streak, here is something I wanted to write and procrastinated for at-least 6 months.

item.title: Dev Diary: Apple Pay
item.description: I’ve recently integrated Apple Pay for an iOS app. Though I have heard it is very easy to integrate and lot of tutorials available, I could not find overall requirements/activities involved in integrating Apple Pay.

item.title: Musical notes images
item.description: For my app Music-notes, I was searching for images of musical notes so I can use them in my flash card feature.

item.title: Speedy - Speed reading application for Mac
item.description: Speedy is an utility application for Mac OS X that lets you speed read the text contents. I created to read the emails & news faster, as I have a tendency to lost in ‘endless space between the words’ with my lack of concentration or I should say gift of imagination?

item.title: How to open/view/share embedded documents in Microsoft Word for Mac (2011/2016)
item.description: You would be surprised to know that Microsoft doesn’t support a viable option to view embedded documents. Embedded PDF’s are the worst, even the .

item.title: Dev Diary
item.description: This is something I’ve started in Jan ‘15. This is to practice a habit of keeping a log of stuff I do which took me a lot of time to figure out myself (may be I’m not efficient?

item.title: Integrating Chromecast with Kaltura SDK (iOS)
item.description: Their documentation says it is built in, but I couldn’t find a sample anywhere, so here it is for everyone on how to integrate Chromecast with your Kaltura Player.

item.title: Image Slicing (Repeatable image) with Xcode Asset Catalog
item.description: Image slicing option in xcode asset catalog allows you to define resiziable area an image so it can be repeated to fit the object’s height & width.

item.title: Book recommendation : Creativity Inc by Ed Catmull
item.description: It is no surprise that you know about Pixar if you are even remotely knew Steve Jobs and his history. And you definitely heard about Pixar’s movies Toy story, Finding Nemo, Wall-E, Up & more.

item.title: Kids these days
item.description: Last weekend I was fortunate to be a technical evaluator of an hackathon. Yes, I’m trying to be vague here, as my company sponsored this event at a most reputed university of our state, this post is just my view.

item.title: Configuring your Airtel Broadband DSL with your modem + wifi router
item.description: My modem failed last week(frequent drops), and I was not willing to repair this time. I’ve taken a screenshots of configuration from my old modem, with the help I was able to configure my new D-Link 2750u.

item.title: Some funniest moments from my appraisal

item.title: How to view (Windows) line ending characters on Mac OSX
item.description: Notepad++ on windows has this beautiful option “View all characters” to display all invisbile characters such as line endings. Programming editors on mac like Textwrangler and Textmate has an option to Show Invisibles but failed to display the character block for Carriage Return as Notepad used to.

item.title: Custom UISplitViewController now available on GitHub
item.description: I created this custom UISplitViewController as one of my iPad project required Split view for only one screen. The default UISplitViewController provided by Apple can only be added to UIWindow which means you can’t use it with normal UINavigation based project with only one splitview screen.

item.title: GotoMeeting Video recording (G2M3 codec for Mac)
item.description: If you use GotoMeeting to record video of the shared screen, make sure that you DO NOT use G2M3 codec. It does a great job in compressing the size of the video but it is not compatible with OSX or any OS other than Windows.

item.description: Check dependencies Code Sign error: Provisioning profile [BEROR]Code Sign error: Provisioning profile ‘579ACFD8-827A-4325-F623-DB8CDD5081DB’ can’t be found Anyone who is relatively new to iPhone development could easily identify this issue is related to the invalid provisioning profile.

item.title: Why AppStore submission process sucks!
item.description: They only check the binary to see if they use any private API nothing other than that. Sometimes they reject the app and give you a reason that it doesn’t fit with their HIG standards.

item.title: How to Register iTunes Account for Free (In Any Country Without A Credit Card)
item.description: Follow the steps below: Launch iTunes Log out of your account (if any) Scroll down the iTunes page and hit the flag on the right Select your country of interest Try to buy a random free app (Note: You will see payment option None only when you register after/while downloading a free app) iTunes will ask you for your credentials, hit open a new account Accept the terms Enter a valid email, pick a password and so on.

item.title: Google Chrome : Hybrid of all
item.description: Webkit as rendering engine like Safari Tabstyles are from Flock Startup page similar to Opera speed-dial and Flock myhome page Paste and go in the address bar like Opera No menu bar like IE 7 Tab-to-window and vice versa from Opera/Safari Incognito browsing similar to Private Browsing Create Application Shortcuts like Mozilla Prism What’s new in Google Chrome No two separate textboxes for URL and for Search Every tab is a separate process Innovative Search, composite of Tortoise Merge (any Textdiff app), Firefox’s (Highlight All) findbox positioned similar to Safari Built-in support for Google Gears Above all its from the giant Google

item.title: Play YouTube with FLV player of your choice
item.description: Not working anymore, but you are free to explore the code. Updates are welcome. I have completed alternative way to view YouTube videos with FLV player of your choice (JW FLV player in this case).

item.title: Tamil.net links xTamil tool
item.description: I’m overwhelmed with happiness after I saw my Google analytics report today. This blog and the new tool which I wrote xTamil - English to Tamil convertor (Unicode) are linked in a Tamil portal site Tamil.

item.title: English to Tamil convertor (Unicode)
item.description: Atlast, I finished my first verison of English to Tamil unicode convertor(Transliterater). What I planned to do was bit different than the one which is available now.

item.title: Clean yahoo webmail without Ad's
item.description: Today, I have uploaded my second Greasemonkey scripts to userscripts, Yahoo webmail++ . This will remove (hide) the advertisements in your yahoo webmail, the one at the top and the small ads on the left side.

item.title: Safari for Windows
item.description: Finally Apple offers Safari for Windows, I am on my Safari now!. But there are bugs in Windows version of Safari, please go through the Techrunch link.

item.title: Why does my dreamweaver look so beautiful?
item.description: I don’t find an alternative title. Like anyone out there, I envy Textmate features where it is present in all the screencasts for PHP & RoR out there.

item.title: My first Greasemonkey script
item.description: Ok. My first Greasemonkey script is available from userscripts.org (http://userscripts-mirror.org/scripts/show/9740) I have been using Greasemonkey for more than a year. Recently I downloaded 2 userscript, GMail superclean and Gmail air, which inspired me to write a script.

item.title: Migrating from blogspot
item.description: I am happy to join the wordpress community. I will post useful snippets and ideas on this blog. So keep an eye on my blog!

item.title: How to implement HSBC Payment Gateway in PHP
item.description: Requirements: 1. Storefront Id - Exactly 13 char string 2. HSBC Hash files - Executable files by HSBC 3. CPI hash key - Exactly 32 char string

item.title: HSBC.php
item.description: <?php /** * @desc Class to process payment using HSBC gateway * This class will return orderhash * 18-Dec-2006 */ class HSBC{ var $storeFrontId; var $hashFilePath; var $CPIhash; var $orderHash; /** * @desc initialize configuration arguements.

item.title: function.php
item.description: <?php /** * @desc Function to print variable for debugging */ function printPre($data, $extended=false) { echo "<pre>"; if($extended) { var_dump($data); } else { print_r($data); } echo "</pre>"; } ?

item.title: hsbc_return.php
item.description: <?php require_once "function.php"; require_once "HSBC.php"; printPre($_POST); $h1 = new HSBC(); echo $h1->error($_POST['CpiResultsCode']); ?>
